title: 11 Easy Ways to Get Rid of Alcohol Breath

steps.title: Drink coffee and water to cover up the alcohol smell.
steps.content: Drink coffee and water to cover up the alcohol smell. Coffee has a strong, distinct smell that can easily cover up the boozy odor on your breath. It also helps wake you up in the morning after a night of drinking. [1] X Research source Accompanying the coffee with a glass of water helps replenish the hydration you lost while drinking and promotes salivation, which can lessen alcohol breath too. [2] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Do not mix coffee (a stimulant) with alcohol (a depressant). This can cause a spike in energy that makes you feel less drunk but leads you to inadvertently drink more than you can handle. [3] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Foods and drinks only mask alcohol breath instead of getting rid of it. The distinct, slightly sweet smell comes from your lungs and stomach, not your mouth. The only way to truly cure alcohol breath is to wait for the alcohol to metabolize out of your system. Your body typically processes 1 ounce (30 ml) of liquor (and its equivalent to beer and wine) in 1 hour. However, the time it takes depends on how much you’ve drunk and other factors like age and gender. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Eat strong-smelling foods like onion and garlic to mask the alcohol.
steps.content: Eat strong-smelling foods like onion and garlic to mask the alcohol. Highly aromatic foods can help override alcohol breath by coating your mouth with their odor. Red onion and garlic both stay on your breath for a long time, reducing the smell of alcohol. [5] X Research source If you’re out at a bar drinking, order foods that contain onion or garlic like garlic fries or garlic bread. Or, add red onions to a sandwich, burger, or salad after drinking. Simply eating onion or garlic raw can replace alcohol breath with another strong, often undesirable, smell. If you’re heading off to work or another event, use one of the other methods to leave your breath smelling more pleasant.

steps.title: Snack on some peanut butter to get rid of your alcohol breath.
steps.content: Snack on some peanut butter to get rid of your alcohol breath. Peanut butter has a strong, sweet, and salty smell that can overpower alcohol odors. Its thick consistency also works to coat your mouth and throat, helping the smell linger for longer. Simply eat a spoonful of peanut butter, make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich, or slather the peanut butter on crackers to mask your alcohol breath.

steps.title: Chew minty gum to keep away odor-causing bacteria.
steps.content: Chew minty gum to keep away odor-causing bacteria. Gum infuses your mouth with a minty aroma, but the act of chewing it also helps keep away the alcohol smell. Chewing increases your saliva production, which prevents bacteria from forming that can worsen your alcohol breath. Mint, spearmint, and cinnamon-flavored gum are typically the best at reducing alcohol odors. As an alternative, try breath mints or suck on mint or herbal-flavored cough drops.

steps.title: Drink lemon water to neutralize alcohol odors.
steps.content: Drink lemon water to neutralize alcohol odors. Lemons are natural deodorizers and bactericides that help hide your alcohol breath and kill odor-causing bacteria and microorganisms in your mouth. [6] X Research source To make lemon water , cut the lemon into thin disks and pour water over them in a glass. Or, simply squeeze a lemon into a glass of water. If you don’t like lemon, use another strong-smelling citrus fruit like lime, orange, or grapefruit. This method also keeps you hydrated, which helps prevent hangover symptoms and reduce alcohol breath.

steps.title: Consume tomato juice or tomato soup to hide the alcohol smell.
steps.content: Consume tomato juice or tomato soup to hide the alcohol smell. Tomatoes have a strong, distinct odor and an acidic composition that can prevent bacterial growth. [7] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Both of these qualities work to mask your alcohol breath. Either drink tomato juice for an extra hydration boost, or make some comforting tomato soup. [8] X Research source To help absorb any remaining alcohol in your stomach, make a grilled cheese sandwich and pair it with your tomato soup.

steps.title: Munch on odor-fighting herbs and spices like parsley and cinnamon.
steps.content: Munch on odor-fighting herbs and spices like parsley and cinnamon. Parsley is a natural deodorizer that can get rid of general bad breath and strong, garlic odors. [9] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Chewing on a few fresh leaves can also help limit alcohol odors. Cinnamon also helps neutralize odors and keep bacteria at bay, making it effective at reducing alcohol breath. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Simply suck on a cinnamon stick, or drop a few into a cup of tea. Alternatively, use parsley as a garnish on potato or pasta dishes. Or, cook parsley into a soup or simply saute it. Coriander, rosemary, and spearmint are also deodorizing herbs and spices that can help you get rid of alcohol breath.

steps.title: Brush your teeth with toothpaste containing menthol.
steps.content: Brush your teeth with toothpaste containing menthol. Brushing your teeth is an easy way to help lessen bad breath associated with drinking. Use a strong-smelling toothpaste, like one that contains menthol, to cover up the alcohol smell the most effectively. [11] X Research source Spend an extra 1 to 2 minutes brushing to get the alcohol residue and alcohol-soaked food out of your mouth.

steps.title: Floss your teeth
steps.content: Floss your teeth to remove any stubborn alcohol smells. Don’t forget to floss after a night of drinking. Food particles that are saturated with alcohol often get stuck between your teeth. They can contribute to alcohol breath even after you've brushed your teeth thoroughly.

steps.title: Gargle with mouthwash
steps.content: Gargle with mouthwash to leave a fresh, minty aftertaste. After you've brushed and flossed, rinse your mouth with an alcohol-free mouthwash for around 30 seconds to 1 minute. Mouthwashes are designed to eliminate bad breath and usually have a minty scent that helps cover alcohol breath. [12] X Research source Spit out the mouthwash after you’re done gargling, then rinse your mouth with water.

steps.title: Shower or bathe to remove alcohol odors on your skin.
steps.content: Shower or bathe to remove alcohol odors on your skin. Alcohol does not just affect your breath. As your body metabolizes and processes the alcohol, the odor also seeps through your pores, causing a boozy scent to waft from your skin. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Take a shower or bath after drinking or the next morning. Use strong-smelling soaps, shampoos, and conditioners to help eliminate or lessen the smell of alcohol. If you still smell slightly boozy after a shower, spray your body with perfume or deodorant to help mask the smell.

steps.title: Drink alcohol in moderation.
steps.content: Drink alcohol in moderation. Drinking moderately, which is defined as 1 standard drink for women and 2 for men, prevents a greater buildup of alcohol in your system that can lead to unpleasant alcohol breath. Instead of binging 4 or more drinks in a night, stick to sipping 1 to 2 drinks over the course of the evening. Binge drinking can not only result in a strong smell but other health problems, especially when done frequently. [14] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Cutting back on drinking, and not drinking to get drunk, can also help prevent alcohol breath. A standard, US alcoholic drink is either a 12-ounce beer (around 5% alcohol by volume (ABV)), 5 ounces of wine (about 12% ABV), or 1.5 ounces of liquor (about 40% ABV).

steps.title: Drink a glass of water after every drink.
steps.content: Drink a glass of water after every drink. Alcohol is a diuretic that causes you to urinate more, which can lead to dehydration. When your mouth is dry, bacteria are more likely to develop and intensify the smell of alcohol on your breath. [15] X Research source Drinking a glass of water after every alcoholic drink keeps you hydrated, which helps you avoid alcohol breath, excessive drinking, and a hangover the next day. [16] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Choose alcoholic drinks that contain water, like mixed drinks with club soda, to hydrate as you drink. Or, water down liquor with ice cubes.

steps.title: Eat before and while you're drinking.
steps.content: Eat before and while you're drinking. When you drink on an empty stomach, alcohol enters your bloodstream quicker. [17] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source This can cause you to drink more and get dehydrated, which can lead to worse alcohol breath. Eating food helps absorbs some of the alcohol you drink while also stimulating the production of saliva to help prevent dehydration. [18] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Bars often provide snacks like peanuts, popcorn, and other munchies to make sure patrons don't get sick from over-drinking. Snack on these complimentary foods while you're out. If you're drinking at a friend's place, bring a snack for the group like bags of potato chips or microwave popcorn. This can help you reduce alcohol breath and make you look generous in the eyes of the host.

steps.title: Do not mix different alcoholic drinks.
steps.content: Do not mix different alcoholic drinks. All alcohol, even the seemingly odorless vodka, gives off a distinct, sweet smell as your body processes it. Each alcohol has a slightly different smell that can combine into an overall worse odor if you mix them together. So, stick to 1 type of alcohol you like for the night to help lessen your alcohol breath. [19] X Research source For example, if your first drink was a beer, keep drinking beer for the night. Or, if you ordered a vodka soda, stick to that or other vodka mixed drinks.

steps.title: Stick to drinking simple, non-mixed drinks.
steps.content: Stick to drinking simple, non-mixed drinks. Mixed drinks that contain sugary liquids, herbs, and spices tend to have a stronger odor than beer, wine, and liquor. Thus, consuming drinks that contain fewer ingredients and aromas helps lessen the smell of alcohol on your breath. [20] X Research source
